page.title: 11Religion
page.content: Most of the people who live in this block belong to the Church of Scotland. The Parish Church is in the village of Auchencairn and there are approximately 150 people on the Church roll. The average congregation however seldom exceeds twenty-five. Auchencairn Parish shares its Minister with the neighbouring parish of Rerrick which has its church in Dundrennan. The Minister holds a service in both churches each Sunday. The church is over one hundred years old and is in good repair but the cost of the up-keep of the Church and the Manse is a heavy burden on the Congregation and it is a continuing battle to raise funds to keep the Church going.
